channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Families accuse Camp Mystic of ignoring risks in Texas lawsuit over flood deaths
item.description: The families of some of the 25 girls and two teenage counselors who died in catastrophic flooding in Texas on July 4 are suing Camp Mystic and its owners.
item.content:encoded:
The families of some of the 25 girls and two teenage counselors who died in catastrophic flooding in Texas on July 4 are suing Camp Mystic and its owners.

(Image credit: Ashley Landis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Shopping for an Affordable Care Act health plan? NPR wants to hear your experience
item.description: If you buy your own health insurance through the ACA marketplaces, how do this year's prices look to you?
item.content:encoded:
If you buy your own health insurance through the ACA marketplaces, how do this year's prices look to you?

(Image credit: Eric Thayer)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Prominent Afrikaners refuse to be 'pawns,' and hit back at Trump's claims about South Africa
item.description: Prominent Afrikaners are pushing back after President Trump announced no U.S. officials will attend the G20 in Johannesburg, rejecting his claims of "white persecution" in South Africa as false and politically driven.
item.content:encoded:
Prominent Afrikaners are pushing back after President Trump announced no U.S. officials will attend the G20 in Johannesburg, rejecting his claims of "white persecution" in South Africa as false and politically driven.

(Image credit: Per-Anders Pettersson)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Public safety groups face an uncertain future months after federal grant cuts
item.description: Six months after the Trump administration cut more than $800 million in Justice Department grants geared toward public safety, the organizations affected are adjusting to a future without that money.
item.content:encoded:
Six months after the Trump administration cut more than $800 million in Justice Department grants geared toward public safety, the organizations affected are adjusting to a future without that money.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Trump slams air traffic controllers who called out during the government shutdown
item.description: Trump said on social media that he wasn't happy with controllers who called out of work, and suggested a $10,000 bonus for those who didn't take any time off during the shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
Trump said on social media that he wasn't happy with controllers who called out of work, and suggested a $10,000 bonus for those who didn't take any time off during the shutdown.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: 'Death by Lightning' unfolds like an 1880s 'West Wing'
item.description: Netflix's new four-part miniseries dives into the plot to assassinate President James Garfield. Death by Lightning is full of recognizable arrogance, political intrigue and unexpected betrayal.
item.content:encoded:
Netflix's new four-part miniseries dives into the plot to assassinate President James Garfield. Death by Lightning is full of recognizable arrogance, political intrigue and unexpected betrayal.

(Image credit: Larry Horricks)
item.dc:creator: David Bianculli

item.title: Watch: FDA Commissioner on lifting warnings on hormone therapy for menopause
item.description: Hormone therapy drugs have carried box warning labels for years. Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Marty Makary talks with NPR about why the agency is removing them.
item.content:encoded: Hormone therapy drugs have carried box warning labels for years. Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Marty Makary talks with NPR about why the agency is removing them.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Car explosion near Red Fort in India's capital kills at least 8 people, police say
item.description: A car exploded near the 17th century Red Fort in New Delhi on Monday, killing at least eight people, injuring others and triggering a fire that damaged vehicles parked nearby, New Delhi police said.
item.content:encoded:
A car exploded near the 17th century Red Fort in New Delhi on Monday, killing at least eight people, injuring others and triggering a fire that damaged vehicles parked nearby, New Delhi police said.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Supreme Court declines to revisit gay marriage decision
item.description: The challenge to the court's 2015 ruling came from Kim Davis, the former Kentucky clerk who refused to issue same-sex licenses after the court's Obergefell v. Hodges decision, which recognized a constitutional right to same-sex marriage.
item.content:encoded:
The challenge to the court's 2015 ruling came from Kim Davis, the former Kentucky clerk who refused to issue same-sex licenses after the court's Obergefell v. Hodges decision, which recognized a constitutional right to same-sex marriage.

(Image credit: Timothy D. Easley)
item.dc:creator: Alyssa Kapasi

item.title: Syrian President Sharaa makes the 1st White House visit by a Syrian head of state
item.description: President Trump hosted Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa at the White House, welcoming the once-pariah state into a U.S.-led global coalition to fight the Islamic State group.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump hosted Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa at the White House, welcoming the once-pariah state into a U.S.-led global coalition to fight the Islamic State group.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
